attributes.title: What are the benefits of using The Plus Addons?

attrs.content: The Plus Addons provides 120+ advanced Gutenberg blocks that extend the default WordPress editor with professional features. You get pixel-perfect layouts, advanced animations, interactive elements, and dynamic content capabilities without writing any code.

Additional benefits include responsive design controls, extensive styling options, ACF repeater integration, WooCommerce support, and regular updates with new blocks and features. All blocks are optimized for performance and SEO.

innerBlocksGuidance.supportedBlocks: Any tpgb block can be used inside accordion items (tp-heading, tp-pro-paragraph, tp-button, tp-image, etc.)

innerBlocksGuidance.performance: Heavy blocks (videos, carousels) inside accordions are lazy-loaded on expansion for better performance

attributes.title: How to add custom CSS to blocks?

attrs.content: You can add custom CSS to any The Plus Addons block using the Additional CSS Classes field in the block settings. Then add your CSS to Appearance → Customize → Additional CSS.
Note: Custom CSS changes are not visible in the editor preview. Always test on the front-end after publishing.

examples.codeFormattingTip: Use <pre> and <code> tags in tp-pro-paragraph for inline code examples. For larger code blocks with syntax highlighting, consider using a dedicated code block plugin.

validationRules.title: Required, the clickable accordion header text
validationRules.index: Required, 0-based index matching parent accordion's accordianList array position
validationRules.uniqueKey: Required for tracking, recommended format: 'acc_' + index
validationRules.defaultAct: Optional, if matches parent's activeIndex, item opens by default (0-based)
validationRules.innerIcon: Boolean, set to true to show icon before title
validationRules.innericonName: Required if innerIcon is true, FontAwesome class (e.g., 'fas fa-home')
validationRules.titleTag: Semantic HTML tag (h3, h4, h5, h6, div), inherited from parent if not set
validationRules.markupSch: Boolean, enable FAQ schema markup for SEO (recommended for FAQ pages)
validationRules.innerBlocks: Array of child blocks, supports any tpgb block for rich content

warnings: CRITICAL: This is a CHILD BLOCK that MUST be inside tpgb/tp-accordion parent - cannot be used independently (inserter: false)
CRITICAL: index value must match position in parent accordion's accordianList array (0-based, first item = 0)
uniqueKey must be unique across all accordion items within the same parent accordion
defaultAct only works if parent accordion's mode is 'accordion' (not 'toggle' where multiple can be open)
If using markupSch (schema markup), ensure title is a question and content is the answer for proper FAQ schema
innerIcon requires innericonName to be set (both attributes work together)
titleTag is optional - if not set, inherits from parent accordion's default titleTag
Toggle icons (plus/minus) are controlled by parent accordion, not individual items
Heavy content (videos, carousels) inside accordion items loads on expansion (lazy load)
Don't use more than 15-20 accordion items in one parent (performance and UX concerns)
titleAlign only affects text alignment, not the entire header (icon position controlled separately by parent)
innerBlocks must contain valid WordPress block objects with blockName and attrs
Each innerBlock needs unique block_id to avoid React rendering issues
markupSch generates FAQPage schema - only use on genuine FAQ pages, not general accordions
hrefLink is rarely used - only for linking accordion item to external resource
commonMistakes: Trying to insert tp-accordion-inner directly without parent tpgb/tp-accordion (won't work - inserter disabled)
Not matching index with actual position in parent accordion (causes wrong item to open)
Forgetting unique _key for innerBlocks items (causes React warnings)
Setting innerIcon: true but forgetting innericonName (icon won't show)
Using markupSch on non-FAQ content (generates incorrect schema markup)
Setting defaultAct without coordinating with parent accordion's activeIndex
Using same uniqueKey for multiple items (breaks tracking)
Not providing block_id for innerBlocks (can cause rendering issues)
Setting titleTag differently from siblings (inconsistent heading hierarchy)
Using titleAlign without understanding it only affects text, not layout
Forgetting to set index when manually creating accordion items
Using numeric index as string '0' instead of number 0 (type matters)
Adding too many innerBlocks (>5-6) making accordion item too heavy
Not testing accordion item in parent context (always test full accordion)
Using generic titles like 'Accordion 1', 'Accordion 2' (bad UX and SEO)
Forgetting closing tags in HTML content within tp-pro-paragraph innerBlocks
bestPractices: Always test accordion items within their parent tpgb/tp-accordion context
Use semantic titleTag values (h3, h4) based on page heading hierarchy
Keep titles concise and descriptive (5-10 words ideal for FAQ questions)
Use innerIcon to visually categorize accordion items (dollar for pricing, cog for technical, etc.)
Enable markupSch for genuine FAQ pages to get rich results in search engines
Use uniqueKey format 'acc_0', 'acc_1', etc. for consistency
Limit innerBlocks to 3-5 blocks per item for optimal UX
Use tp-row and tp-column inside accordion items for complex layouts (image + text)
Set defaultAct: 0 for first item in FAQ accordions (shows answer immediately)
Use title as question, innerBlocks as answer for FAQ schema compliance
Keep content scannable with headings, bullet lists, and short paragraphs
Use tp-stylist-list for feature lists inside accordion items
Add CTAs (tp-button) inside accordion items when appropriate
Test mobile responsiveness - accordion items stack vertically on small screens
Use titleAlign: 'text-left' for FAQ/documentation, 'text-center' for features
Provide meaningful titles that work standalone (users scan before clicking)
Use consistent icon library (font_awesome) across all innerIcon instances
Keep index sequential (0, 1, 2, 3) matching visual order
Coordinate defaultAct with parent accordion's activeIndex attribute
Use <strong> tags sparingly in content for emphasis (too many diminish effect)
For code examples, use <pre> and <code> tags for proper formatting
Test accordion item expansion animation (default 300ms smooth transition)
Consider using tp-blockquote for testimonial accordion items
Group related accordion items (all pricing, all features, all FAQs) together

parentControls.styling: Parent controls all visual styling (colors, borders, shadows, typography)
parentControls.layout: Parent controls icon position (left/right), spacing, alignment
parentControls.behavior: Parent controls accordion/toggle mode, animation speed, default active item
parentControls.icons: Parent sets toggle icons (plus/minus), child can override with innerIcon

childControls.content: Child controls its own title and innerBlocks content
childControls.innerIcon: Child can add optional icon before title
childControls.index: Child must coordinate index with parent array position
childControls.uniqueKey: Child sets unique identifier for tracking

schemaMarkupGuide.whenToUse: Enable markupSch: true ONLY for genuine FAQ pages where title is a question and content is the answer

acceptedAnswer.text: WordPress is a free and open-source content management system...

benefits: Rich results in Google search (FAQ accordion shows directly in search results)
Voice search optimization (Alexa, Google Assistant read FAQ answers)
requirements: Title must be a clear question (starts with Who/What/When/Where/Why/How or Is/Does/Can)
Content must be a direct answer (not promotional text or unrelated content)
Minimum 2 FAQ items recommended for schema validation
Keep answers concise (140-300 characters ideal for featured snippets)
Don't use schema for general accordions (pricing, features, testimonials)
testingSchema: Check Google Search Console for FAQ schema detection
Monitor search appearance after 2-4 weeks for rich results

accessibilityConsiderations: Accordion items are keyboard accessible (Tab to focus, Enter/Space to toggle)
ARIA attributes automatically added (aria-expanded, aria-controls, role='button')
Use semantic titleTag (h3, h4) for proper heading hierarchy and screen readers
Ensure sufficient color contrast for title text (WCAG 4.5:1 for normal text)
Toggle icons should have aria-label (parent accordion handles this)
innerIcon should be decorative (aria-hidden='true') - meaning conveyed in title text
markupSch helps screen readers understand FAQ structure
Test with keyboard navigation: Tab (navigate), Enter (toggle), Shift+Tab (reverse)
Expansion animation should respect prefers-reduced-motion CSS media query
Provide clear, descriptive titles (avoid 'Click here' or 'Learn more')
performanceOptimization: Accordion items use lazy loading - content only rendered when item expands
Heavy content (videos, carousels) won't impact initial page load
Use image lazy loading inside accordion items (WordPress native lazy='loading')
Limit innerBlocks to essential content (don't nest complex layouts unnecessarily)
Parent accordion uses CSS visibility vs display:none for smooth transitions
Total accordion items recommended limit: 15-20 items per parent (UX and performance)
Test mobile performance - accordions improve mobile UX by hiding content by default
Consider pagination or filtering for 20+ accordion items
SVG icons (innerIcon) perform better than image icons (smaller file size)

solutions: Verify you're inside a tpgb/tp-accordion parent block
Check parent accordion has space for new items
Try adding item via parent accordion's 'Add Item' control instead
Check browser console for JavaScript errors

troubleshooting.issue: Item opens when it shouldn't / wrong item opens
solutions: Verify index value matches actual position (0-based: first=0, second=1)
Check uniqueKey is unique across all items
Verify defaultAct matches parent accordion's activeIndex
Check parent accordion mode (accordion vs toggle)
Verify innerIcon is set to true (not false)
Check innericonName has valid FontAwesome class (e.g., 'fas fa-home')
Verify FontAwesome is loaded on the page (parent theme/plugins)
Check for CSS conflicts hiding the icon
Verify markupSch is set to true
Check title is formatted as a question
Test with Google Rich Results Test tool
Ensure minimum 2 FAQ items for schema validation
Verify content structure (simple text, not complex HTML)
Check innerBlocks don't have CSS position:fixed (breaks animation)
Verify no JavaScript errors in browser console
Check parent accordion's animation duration setting
Test without browser extensions (some block animations)
Clear browser cache and test in incognito mode
Check titleTag is consistent across all items
Verify custom CSS isn't targeting specific block_id
Check titleAlign is same for all items
Verify parent accordion styling applies equally to all children
Clear any cached CSS (theme caching, CDN)
